checking.compile

Class HaskellCompileChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • checking.compile.HaskellCompileChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CompileChecker

    public class HaskellCompileChecker
extends java.lang.Object
implements CompileChecker
    This class provides the means to check submissions in Haskell for correct compilation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HaskellCompileChecker()
      The constructor for the compileChecker only checks if ghci can be found in PATH on windows systems.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile, java.nio.file.Path outputFolder, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
      GHC doesnt produce outputfiles in our implementation so this just reroutes to checkProgram(Path, String, List).
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
      checkProgram invokes the Haskell compiler on a given file and reports the output.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HaskellCompileChecker

        public HaskellCompileChecker()
        The constructor for the compileChecker only checks if ghci can be found in PATH on windows systems.

    • Method Detail

      • checkProgram

        public CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile,
                          java.lang.String compilerName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   BadCompilerSpecifiedException,
                                   BadFlagException
        checkProgram invokes the Haskell compiler on a given file and reports the output.
        Specified by:
        checkProgram in interface CompileChecker
        Parameters:
        pathToProgramFile - Specifies the file or folder containing that should be compiled. (accepts .lhs and .hs files)
        compilerName - The compiler to be used (usually ghc).
        compilerFlags - Additional flags to be passed to the compiler.
        Returns:
        A CompilerOutput that contains all compiler messages and flags on how the compile run went.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Is thrown when the file in pathToProgramFile cannot be opened
        BadCompilerSpecifiedException - Is thrown when the given compiler cannot be called
        BadFlagException - When ghc doesn't recognize a flag, this exception is thrown.

      • checkProgram

        public CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile,
                          java.nio.file.Path outputFolder,
                          java.lang.String compilerName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   BadCompilerSpecifiedException,
                                   BadFlagException,
                                   CompilerOutputFolderExistsException
        GHC doesnt produce outputfiles in our implementation so this just reroutes to checkProgram(Path, String, List).
        Specified by:
        checkProgram in interface CompileChecker
        Parameters:
        pathToProgramFile - The Path to a File that is to be compiled. Dependencies on other files are resolved automatically, if a valid package structure is found.
        outputFolder - The file compiler output is written to.
        compilerName - Name of the compiler that should be called. For example "javac" or "openjavac" if both oracle javac and openjdk are installed.
        compilerFlags - Additional flags to be passed to the compiler, each as a list item.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the program did compile (true) or not (false)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - When the given sourcefile cannot be found.
        BadCompilerSpecifiedException - When the given compiler can't be located.
        BadFlagException - When javac doesn't recognize a flag, this exception is thrown.
        CompilerOutputFolderExistsException - When the given output folder already exists. We require it to not exist, since we might stomp on important files otherwise.
